etymologies: early 17th century: from Dutch, or from German Morgen ‘morning’, apparently from the notion of ‘an area of land that can be plowed in a morning’

definitions: (in the Netherlands, South Africa, and parts of the US) a measure of land equal to about 0.8 hectare or two acres.
shortDefinitions: (in Netherlands, South Africa, and parts of US) measure of land equal to about 0.8 hectare

definitions: (in Norway, Denmark, and Germany) a measure of land now equal to about 0.3 hectare or two thirds of an acre.
shortDefinitions: (in Norway, Denmark, and Germany) measure of land now equal to about 0.3 hectare
